text: Hi! Iâ€™m having trouble creating a developer account. I get a 403 error message when trying to create one, from my Enterprise account. I inspected the console, the create webpage is blank. /signup/v1/developers/signup/existing
Hi Kari, can you try creating a dev account from this link please: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/>
Click the 'create a developer account' button on the the top right of the page and follow the steps.
LMK if you still get an error?

Hi, I'm relatively new to the API. I got a few questions concerning the E-Mail endpoints.

When i pull data from "/email/public/v1/events". I get the User, his actions and a campaignId. To get the name of the E-Mail i need to pull data from "/email/public/v1/campaigns/{campaign_id}" where campaign_id is the id from the user's action. In the second response will be the contentId which corresponds to the id from the endpoint "/marketing-emails/v1/emails". Which now gives me the name of the E-Mail to match the users activity.

Now to my Questions:
1. Is there any other way to merge the e-mail name to the activity?
2. Will there always be a single contentId per campaignId? Or could it be possible that, let's say one campaignId has multiple contentIds corresponding to multiple E-Mails?
Hi! Still the same error. Blank page after choosing which user to proceed with
Hi Joachim, you can use the Pipelines API to fetch stage definitions, and use that to interpret the `dealstage` value

There's no guarantee that the raw value will be human-readable - sometimes it might be, and other . times it might be numbers or random identifiers. The correct way to interpret it is to use the Pipelines API
Hi Kari, thanks for the update. Is it possible to open this link: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/> in an incognito browser window.  This should force you to login through a screen like this:
LMK what happens after you reach this screen and log in.
Question for API v3 - is there any reason that an associated contact wouldn't be showing up in a record from the API? Example - in the interface, I see this ticket and an associated contact.
When I look in the API result, it's NA:
Anyone run into this yet in Contacts and Tickets v4?
